info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 6:12PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Custer, northwestern Oglala Lakota and southern Pennington Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 612 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Red Shirt, or 31 miles northeast of Hot Springs, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Red Shirt, Red Shirt Table Overlook and southwestern Badlands National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm is producing large quantities of hail. Driving through deep hail is like driving on slushy roads. Slow down and do not brake suddenly.
